titleStmt.title: Iter boreale Attempting somthing upon the successful and matchless march of the Lord Generall George Monck, from Scotland, to London, the last winter, &c. Veni, vidi, vici. By a rural pen.
titleStmt.author: Wild, Robert, 1609-1679.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed on St George's Day, for George Thomason, at the Rose and Crown in St Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Text and register are continuous despite pagination.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
